TopicTitle: Elite dangerous Vanilla and Horizons noob survival tips?

Articles.Content:
Hi any tips for a noob in Elite Dangerous Vanilla and Horizons expansion pack?

Like combat Survival tips and if forced into combat bye NPC or player PVP?

Trading tips?

Mining tips?

Exploring tips?

And Joystick config set ups?

My Joystick is a Thrustmaster T-16000M Flight stick

And a Xbox one controller.

i had played the game for about two hours before i became comfortable with navigation. did the beer run and racked up a couple bounties in the process. then i decided to go asteroid mining. this took forever and was tedius, especially because i could only refine one ore at a time. i had to watch plantum float by because i had 95% gold. i came back with gold, platnum, and silver. unfortunately i got my landing gear mixed up with my cargo eject and ejected the cargo in the station during landing. to add insult to injury they fined me for it. i had never ragequit a game so fast. i havent played since.

Edited January 29, 2016 by Nuke

As far as PvP goes, I've found running away to be the most rewarding strategy.  (You might be more hardcore than I however :D)  Many PvPers will re-interdict you after fleeing.  If so, simply either jump to another system, or drop back out of supercruise as soon as possible and boost for a while in case they scan your wake and follow.  Hiding in normal space for a couple of minutes is a reasonable strategy.

For PvE, the Kill Warrent Scanner is essential for maximising cash returns from combat.

The Cobra Mk3 is the fastest ship ingame and will outrun most ships with ease.  I would highly recommend it as a first ship upgrade.  Not only is it the quintessential ship as far as Elite lore goes, but it's also an excellent multipurpose ship.

The Asp Explorer and Imperial Clipper are two other ships I highly favour (although you will need a few ranks with the Empire to get access to the latter.)  In fact these two are my day-to-day workhorses.

 

Exploring:

Get the Advanced Discovery and Detailed Surface Scanners asap.  You can make non-trivial amounts of money scanning systems as you go about your daily business quite easily.

If you are looking to go exploring proper and get your name on some objects (and get the cash bonus for being the first to discover thigs) go above or below the galactic plane before heading towards any interesting-looking nebula.  Many of the direct routes will tend to have been heavily travelled.

 

Mining is fairly meh in my opinion.  You are going to want to use prospector and collection limpets if you want to make any serious cash in a reasonable timeframe, and really try to focus on collecting painite and the like which are often sought on the bulletin board.  Try to find pristine metallic rings for best results, and avoid RES sites, unless you want to spice up your mining with combat.

 

Get a fuel scoop.  You will need it at some point.  Remember you can only scoop from KGBFOAM class stars.  The fuel rats are a player group that can help you if you ignore this bit of advice.

 

DO NOT, REPEAT, DO NOT FLY SOMETHING YOU CANNOT AFFORD THE INSURANCE FOR.

 

Be aware of the community goals.  Some are listed in Galnet, some only seem to be listed on the community goals thread on the forums.  Can be good money for relatively little work.

 

There is no shame in dropping into solo play at times.  Well, there is, but only you will know ;D

 

Over 1200 hours ingame, and about 25 years playing games in the Elite universe.  As a game, it's not for everyone, but it's exactly what I expected as a veteran of the older games.  pxi vonstaat ingame if you want to say hi, although the beta for SF5 will be sucking up most of my free time over the weekend.
